Type Safety

Preservation

preservation theorem

  • induction on typing; prove it type-preserving after reduction/evaluation (what about induction on reduction?)
  • ST_AppAbs æ¯”è¾ƒéº»çƒ¦ï¼Œéœ€è¦åš substitutionï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥æˆ‘ä»¬éœ€è¦è¯æ˜ substituion æœ¬èº«æ˜¯ type-preservingâ€¦ substitution lemma

Free Occurrences

åœ¨ PLT/TAPL ä¸­ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬å°† â€œfree variables of an termâ€ å®šä¹‰ä¸ºä¸€ä¸ªé›†åˆ FV(t). (é›†åˆæ˜¯ä¸€ç§ computational çš„æ¦‚å¿µ)

    FV(x) = {x}

åœ¨è¿™é‡Œï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬åˆ™å°† â€œappears_free inâ€ å®šä¹‰ä¸º var x ä¸ term t ä¸Šçš„äºŒå…ƒå…³ç³»: (è¯»ä½œ judgement å³å¯)

      appears_free_in x (var x)

      appears_free_in x t1 â†’
      appears_free_in x (app t1 t2)

      appears_free_in x t2 â†’

Hint Constructors appears_free_in.

(** a term with no free vars. ç­‰ä»·äº Â¬(âˆƒx,  appears_free_in x t). **) 
Definition closed (t:tm) :=           âˆ€x, Â¬appears_free_in x t.

An open term is one that may contain free variables.
â€œOpenâ€ precisely means â€œpossibly containing free variables.â€

the closed terms are a subset of the open ones. closed æ˜¯ open çš„å­é›†â€¦è¿™æ ·å®šä¹‰å—ï¼ˆ

Free Vars is in Context

   Gamma âŠ¢ t âˆˆ T â†’
   âˆƒT', Gamma x = Some T'.

    empty âŠ¢ t âˆˆ T â†’
    closed t.

Not subject expansion

1
2

Theorem not_subject_expansion:
  ~(forall t t' T, t --> t' /\ empty |- t' \in T -> empty |- t \in T).

1
2
3
4

(app (abs x (Arrow Bool Bool) tru) tru)  -- è€ƒè™‘ term 

(Î»x:Bool->Bool . tru) tru   -->   tru    -- å¯ä»¥ step
                    empty   |-   Bool    -- step å well-typed

empty |-/-  (Î»x:Bool->Bool . tru) tru    -- ä½†æ˜¯åŸ term æ˜¾ç„¶ ill-typed

Type Soundness

(** stuck å³åœ¨ä¸æ˜¯ value çš„æ—¶å€™æ— æ³• step **)
Definition stuck (t:tm) : Prop :=
  (normal_form step) t âˆ§ Â¬value t.

(** well-typed term never get stuck! **)
Corollary soundness : âˆ€t t' T,
  empty âŠ¢ t âˆˆ T â†’
  t -->* t' â†’
  ~(stuck t').

STLC with Arithmetic

Inductive ty : Type :=
  | Arrow : ty â†’ ty â†’ ty
  | Nat : ty.            (** <-- the only concrete base type **)


Inductive tm : Type :=
  | var : string â†’ tm
  | app : tm â†’ tm â†’ tm
  | abs : string â†’ ty â†’ tm â†’ tm
  | const : nat â†’ tm     (** <-- å±…ç„¶ç”¨ metalang çš„ nat è€Œé zro **)
  | scc : tm â†’ tm
  | prd : tm â†’ tm
  | mlt : tm â†’ tm â†’ tm
  | test0 : tm â†’ tm â†’ tm â†’ tm.
